question.title: Spring cache returns empty result
question.body:
I use

@Cacheable(value = "provider", key = "#providerId")
public synchronized Provider getProviderByProviderId(String providerId, String authorization) {

on a method that fetches the provider from a URL. The method is not called, and always return an empty value. Why is that?

I want that when I call the method - if the "providerId" is new - enter the method, otherwise return from the cache.

I tried different Cache annotations (Cachable or cache put), on different places (on the method or the class), or on different methods (one level of calls or two levels of calls)

answers.body:
You just need to add sync=true to you annotation. After all, your method is synchronized.

@Cacheable(value = "provider", key = "#providerId", sync = true)
